title: Bug 49299: Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 states custom cookie name affects URL rewriting
description: In chapter 7.1.1 of servlet30finalspec.pdf, it is mentioned that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same custom name will also be used as the name of the URI parameter if the session id is encoded in the URL (assuming URL rewriting is enabled). However, the actual behavior does not match the expected behavior as the Reload link on the page uses the default 'jsessionid' parameter instead of the custom cookie name.
OB:
The page sends the following cookie:
SetCookie: MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F; Path=/cookiename; HttpOnly
but the Reload link on the page uses 'jsessionid':
http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;jsessionid=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F4.
EB:
Expecting the Reload link to use the custom cookie name as the name of the URI parameter, the link should be:
http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F
